item.title: DES 3YR sample analysis with PISCOLA
item.description:
Here I present the analisys of DES SNe with PISCOLA. The idea of this book is to show the whole process of working in a project and making the whole analysis as transparent as possible.

Press the tag below to see more examples

item.title: PISCOLA
item.description:
Python for Intelligent Supernova COsmology Light-curve Analysis (PISCOLA) is a code I have developed as part of my PhD to fit Type Ia supernova light curves in a data-driven way using Gaussian Process. The post analysis is done with Non-negative Matrix Factorization, a machine learning approach to extract features/parameters from the rest-frame light curves in order to do cosmology (Müller-Bravo et al., in prep.).

Press the tag below to see more examples

item.title: Type II supernova fitting code
item.description:
Type II supernova fitting code by Ondrej Pejcha. I contributed some minor modifications and am currently hosting the repository with the code.

Press the tag below to see more examples

item.title: PESSTO data-reduction pipeline
item.description:
Pipeline for the reduction of data from the New Technology Telescope (La Silla observatory, Chile). The original pipeline was developed by Stephano Valenti as part of the PESSTO collaboration. I am the current developer and manager of this pipeline as part of ePESSTO+ collaboration.

Press the tag below to see more examples

item.title: TESSreduce
item.description:
The Transitin Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) produces light curves with unprecedented cadence. This is ideal for studying supernovae, but there is not dedicated pipeline to extract and reduce the data of these transients. I have worked on this project, led by Ryan Ridden-Harper.

Press the tag below to see more examples
